Name: VP

Description: VP is for Settlement Founded
Name: Found

Description: VP is for Settlement Conquered
Name: Conquer

Description: VP is for Settlement Found, Lost, then Reacquired
Name: Reacquire

Description: Must be in Distant Lands
Name: DistantLands

Description: Have I joined an Ideology?
Name: HaveIdeology

Description: Must be of another Ideology
Name: OpposingIdeology

Description: Must be following this player's religion
Name: FollowsReligion

Description: VP lost if recaptured
Name: Reversible

Description: VP can only be scored once for this map location
Name: OncePerLocation

Description: Legacy path
Name: LegacyPathType

Description: VP scored for this action
Name: VP

Description: If specified, only counts points for this unit
Name: Unit

Description: Legacy path
Name: LegacyPathType

Description: VP scored for this action
Name: VP

Description: VP is for Wonder Conquered
Name: Conquer

Description: VP is for Wonder Built, Lost, then Reacquired
Name: Reacquire

Description: VP lost if recaptured
Name: Reversible

Description: The amount to adjust the population by.
Name: Amount

Description: Whether or not to adjust the population of the smallest settlement.
Name: SmallestPopulationSettlement

Description: System type hash, e.g. SYSTEM_CULTURE
Name: SystemType

Description: A list of progression node types to apply to. If no node type is given, will apply to all of them in a tree.
Name: ProgressionTreeNodeType

Description: If no node type is given and this is true it will skip being applied to repeatable nodes.
Name: ExcludeRepeatables

Description: The amount of settlement cap to add. If paired with the minimum flag, will increase settlement cap up to this amount.
Name: Amount

Description: Changes the functionality to increase settlement cap up to the amount specified. This will either apply only to age or ageless based on the ageless tag.
Name: Minimum

Description: If this is specified, will add to the cap, but will not count to how much is carried over into the next age. This is called ageless as it should be used for abilities, such as leaders and attribute nodes, which will add their values again every age
Name: Ageless

Description: If this is a Crisis slot or not.
Name: Negative

Description: If this effect should happen at the start or end of a Golden Age.
Name: Start

Description: Unit type.  As a specific unit, this will override the UnitClass and Domain
Name: UnitType

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or Domain
Name: Tag

Description: Unit type.  As a specific unit, this will override the UnitClass and Domain
Name: UnitType

Description: Uses UNIT_CLASS vocabulary.  Unit class can specify a number of units, and can be combined with Domain.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: UnitClass

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or Domain
Name: UnitTag

Description: Uses the Domain types, which are not in a database definition.  Can be combined with UnitClass.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: Domain

Description: Unit type.  As a specific unit, this will override the UnitClass and Domain
Name: UnitType

Description: Uses UNIT_CLASS vocabulary.  Unit class can specify a number of units, and can be combined with Domain.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: UnitClass

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or Domain
Name: UnitTag

Description: Uses the Domain types, which are not in a database definition.  Can be combined with UnitClass.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: Domain

Description: Unit type.  As a specific unit, this will override the UnitClass and Domain
Name: UnitType

Description: Uses UNIT_CLASS vocabulary.  Unit class can specify a number of units, and can be combined with Domain.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: UnitClass

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or Domain
Name: UnitTag

Description: Uses the Domain types, which are not in a database definition.  Can be combined with UnitClass.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: Domain

Description: A list of the yields to give
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount of the yields specified to give
Name: Amount

Description: Player level yields only - no production or food
Name: YieldType

Description: Overrides the Amount argument with yields from the specified narrative reward table
Name: DatabaseAmountOverride

Description: Scales number of turns for game speed
Name: Scale

Description: Player level yields only - no production or food
Name: YieldType

Description: The type of yield to modify.
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount to add/remove from the yield
Name: Amount

Description: The yield to adjust
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount to adjust the yield by
Name: Amount

Description: Resources that originate in Distant Lands only
Name: DistantLands

Description: Resources imported in Trade only
Name: Imported

Description: Resources that have not been assigned to a settlement
Name: Unassigned

Description: The yield to give
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount of the yield to give
Name: Amount

Description: The type of yield to modify.
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount to add to the yield
Name: Amount

Description: A list of the yields to affect by this reduction
Name: YieldTypes

Description: The amount to reduce the yields
Name: Amount

Description: The maximum reduction in yields
Name: MaxReduction

Description: Percentage of FromYield that is awarded as ToYield
Name: Percent

Description: Yield converted from, typically Gold
Name: FromYieldType

Description: Output yield
Name: ToYieldType

Description: Scales amount for game speed
Name: Scale

Description: A comma separated list of tag names further filter the units under consideration.
Name: Tags

Description: Set true if the unit must match all supplied tags. Default behavior is that only one provided tag needs to match.
Name: MatchAllTags

Description: First looks for unit with the most commendations, before breaking ties with number of levels.
Name: PrioritizeCommendations

Description: Does not consider level. Operates purely off of Experience value. Can be combined with PrioritizeCommendations.
Name: ExperienceOnly

Description: Added percent to the amount of favors accrued.
Name: Percent

Description: Action Group type actions that will be modified.  Currently DIPLOMACY_ACTION_GROUP_PROJECT, _ENDEAVOR, _SANCTION
Name: ActionGroup

Description: Added percent to the rate of progress per envoy.
Name: Percent

Description: The type of action the modifier is for.
Name: ActionType

Description: Added percent to the amount of favors accrued.
Name: Percent

Description: The type of war to ignore requirements for declaring
Name: WarType

Description: FavorAmount can be used in place of Amount
Name: FavorsAmount

Description: Grievance Event Type related to the Grievance Amount.  Defaults to GRIEVANCE_FROM_PROJECT
Name: GrievancesEventType

Description: Favor Event Type related to the Favor Amount.  Defaults to FAVOR_FROM_PROJECT
Name: FavorsEventType

Description: Comma delimited list for specific attribute nodes to grant.  If left blank, then unit is granted promotion points.
Name: AttributeNodeType

Description: Each grouping of stories selects additional amount from base line
Name: Amount

Description: Positive is favors, negative is grievances. Relationship with the target will change by +/- the Amount
Name: Amount

Description: Civilization to target
Name: TargetCivilization

Description: The name a TAG that the constructible must have to get a free purchase charge.
Name: Tag

Description: Whether or not we should queue up another golden age / celebration if one is already active.
Name: CanQueueDuringGoldenAge

Description: The type of unit to grant.
Name: UnitType

Description: The best sea domain unit with the tag that is available to the Player will be granted. Will be ignored if a UnitType was provided.
Name: UnitTag

Description: Whether or not to give a civ unique unit in place of what was specified in UnitType
Name: AllowUniqueOverride

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Name: UnitTag

Description: Uses the Domain types, which are not in a database definition.  Can be combined with UnitClass.  Be careful of mutually exclusive class and domains which could result in applying to no units
Name: DomainType

Description: When spawning treasure convoys, use this to indicate how much treasure they have. 1 is equivalent to 1 treasure resource
Name: TreasureAmount

Description: Changes the cost of wonders when purchasing them. Use a negative value to increase the cost.
Name: PurchaseEfficiency

Description: Optional age specifier for reward.  Defaults to the current age.
Name: AgeType

Description: Number of tiers the relationships should be lowered by.
Name: Amount

Description: Amount can be positive to give yields or negative to incur a yield cost on the player
Name: Amount

Description: Player level yields only - no production or food
Name: YieldType

Description: Scales amount for game speed
Name: Scale

Description: The yield will be reduced by the percent
Name: ReductionPercent

Description: Generates artifacts for natural wonders
Name: AllowNaturalWonders

Description: The constructible to replace.
Name: Destroy

Description: The constructible to replace the Destroy constructible with.
Name: Create

Description: Positive is favors, negative is grievances
Name: Amount

Description: false = apply to all civs with the same goverment type. true = apply to all civs without the same government type
Name: Inverse

Description: Limits the effects only to target other governments on this list of types.
Name: GovernmentTypes

Description: The government type to change to. Can be a list of Government Types.
Name: GovernmentType

Description: Pick a random type from the GovernmentType list given.
Name: Random

Description: The number of cities we will attempt to spawn tribes by.
Name: NumCities

Description: If we want to spawn armies instead for each village that fails to spawn.
Name: SpawnArmies

Description: The number of combat units to spawn if SpawnArmies is true
Name: NumCombatUnits

Description: The TribeType to use for the tribe. If not specified, uses a default
Name: TribeType

Description: Positive is favors, negative is grievances. Relationship with the target will change by +/- the Amount
Name: Amount

Description: IF this effect should take place only the turn when war was declared or throughout the war
Name: OnlyWarChangedTurn

Description: A list of the yields to affect by this reduction
Name: YieldTypes

Description: The amount to reduce the yields
Name: Amount

Description: A list of the yields to adjust
Name: YieldTypes

Description: The amount to adjust the yields
Name: Amount

Description: Flat amount of yield added per unique improved natural wonder.
Name: Amount

Description: Percent increase to yields per unique improved natural wonder.
Name: Percent

Description: The type of yields to increase, can take a list.
Name: YieldType

Description: Can be any command on this list (more can be added by changing the CPP check): UNITCOMMAND_MAKE_TRADE_ROUTE or UNITCOMMAND_CONNECT_WITH_ROAD
Name: CommandType

Description: The type of yield to grant. Must be a player-level yield
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount of yield to grant -- will be multiplied by number of resources (for a trade route command) if PerResource boolean is true
Name: Amount

Description: Does the award multiply with a trade route with more than 1 resource
Name: PerResource

Description: Does the trade route created include a Navigable River?
Name: IncludesNavigableRiver

Description: Scale amount by game speed?
Name: AdjustByGameSpeed

Description: The amount of yield to grant -- will be multiplied by number the relationship of the players (for a trade route command) if PerRalationship boolean is true
Name: PerRelationship

Description: The amount to adjust the fortification number of turns by. Positive increases, negative decreases it
Name: Amount

Description: Can be any command on this list (more can be added by changing the CPP check): UNITOPERATION_EXCAVATE
Name: OperationType

Description: The type of yield to grant. Must be a player-level yield
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount of yield to grant -- will be multiplied by distance to Capital
Name: Amount

Description: Does the award multiply based on the distance to capital
Name: DistanceToCapital

Description: The type of yield to modify. Only accepts player yields
Name: YieldType

Description: The amount to add to the yield
Name: Amount

Description: Whether or not a unit can plunder trade routes between other civs.
Name: CanPlunder

Description: The type of Unit to grant to the Player. Will trump any other unit parameters provided.
Name: UnitType

Description: Will search for the best unit with UnitTag available to the Player. Can work in conjunction with Domain.
Name: UnitTag

Description: Will search for the best unit in Domain available to the Player. Can work in conjunction with UnitTag.
Name: DomainType

Description: Amount of Units to grant to the Player
Name: Amount

Description: Whether or not to allow unique override
Name: AllowUniqueOverride

Description: Which resource are assigned to the city.  Can be a comma separated list.
Name: ResourceTypes

Description: Check if the commander in a commander's radius is higher level
Name: IsHigherLevelCommander

Description: How many players to count.  Default will count if another player has at least 1 settlement following your religion.  It is an error to set this and AllPlayers.
Name: Amount

Description: Counts all alive majors.  It is an error to set with OnlyDistantLandsPlayers or OnlyHomelandsPlayers.
Name: AllPlayers

Description: Counts only players in distant lands.  It is an error to set with AllPlayers or OnlyHomelandsPlayers.
Name: OnlyDistantLandsPlayers

Description: Counts only player in homelands.  It is an error to set with OnlyDistantLandsPlayers or AllPlayers.
Name: OnlyHomelandsPlayers

Description: Counts only players if their majority religion is your founded religion.
Name: MajorityOnly

Description: Counts only the player's founded religion.
Name: PlayerFounded

Description: Counts only the player's majority religion.
Name: PlayerMajority

Description: The victory type to check for
Name: VictoryType

Description: The amount of support required. If MoreThanOpponent or LessThanOpponent is set, then it is difference of tokens between for/against. Otherwise it is total tokens
Name: Amount

Description: bool for if we are checking for more support than opponents. Amount will compare total for minus total against.
Name: MoreThanOpponent

Description: bool for if we are checking for less support than opponents. Amount will compare total against minus total for.
Name: LessThanOpponent

Description: The milestone which has been achieved.
Name: AgeProgressionMilestoneType

Description: The tag to match against.
Name: Tag

Description: Whether or not to include the center hex.
Name: IncludeCenter

Description: Minimum number of enemy units
Name: NumUnits

Description: The tag to match against.
Name: Tag

Description: Whether or not to include the center hex.
Name: IncludeCenter

Description: Require that the district be functioning (not damaged).
Name: MustBeFunctioning

Description: Crisis stage count where the requirement is met. Cannot be used with an upper or lower bound. Default operator is >=
Name: Amount

Description: AgeCrisisType from the AgeCrises table.
Name: AgeCrisisType

Description: Age progression total where the requirement is met. Cannot be used with an upper or lower bound. Default operator is >=
Name: Amount

Description: Age progression percentage total where the requirement is met. Cannot be used with an upper or lower bound. Default operator is >=
Name: Percent

Description: AgeProgressionType from the AgeProgressions table.
Name: AgeProgressionType

Description: The inclusive upper boundary age point total to check. Must be used with a lower bound amount.
Name: UpperBoundAmount

Description: The inclusive lower boundary age point total to check. Must be used with an upper bound amount.
Name: LowerBoundAmount

Description: The inclusive upper boundary age point percent to check. Must be used with a lower bound percent.
Name: UpperBoundPercent

Description: The inclusive lower boundary age point percent to check. Must be used with an upper bound percent.
Name: LowerBoundPercent

Description: The operator to use with the provided amount or percent. Valid operators: >=, <=, >, <, =.
Name: Operator

Description: A comma separated list of tag names that we are checking against in this requirement.
Name: Tags

Description: If false, checks if the subject follows the religion of the owner of the modifier, not the owner of the city.
Name: cityReligion

Description: if true, only returns true if the city has a religion. Useful for checking the inverse.
Name: hasReligion

Description: Amount of the biome tiles in range.
Name: Amount

Description: Comma separate list of buildings used to check adjacencies.  Be careful with using buildings which can have multiples in a city, such as improvements, because build order can matter.  In those cases avoid fertility and building adjacencies as they change through the game
Name: BuildingType

Description: All buildings will count.  Be careful, if you don't specify BuildingCount then all buildings will need to meet the adjacencies.
Name: AnyBuilding

Description: Comma separated list for building types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy
Name: AdjacentBuildingTypes

Description: Comma separated list for biome types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy
Name: AdjacentBiomeTypes

Description: Comma separated list for feature types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy
Name: AdjacentFeatureTypes

Description: Comma separated list for terrain types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy
Name: AdjacentTerrainTypes

Description: Comma separated list for fertility types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy.
Name: AdjacentFertilityTypes

Description: Comma separated list for feature classes.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy
Name: AdjacentFeatureClassTypes

Description: Comma separated list for resource types.  Default is adjacent to all to satisfy
Name: AdjacentResourceTypes

Description: Checks if adjacent to river
Name: AdjacentRiver

Description: Checks if adjacent to lake
Name: AdjacentLake

Description: Comma separated list for unique quarter types. Quarter to be adjacent too
Name: AdjacentQuarterTypes

Description: Amount of the adjacency arguments that must be satisfied.
Name: Amount

Description: Count of buildings that meet the adjacencies. Default is all buildings specified
Name: BuildingCount

Description: For each of the adjacencies, the building needs to be adjacent to this many. Each adjaceny group can only have one entry. Doesn't work with river or lake adjacency. If set, needs to at least be 2.
Name: DuplicateCount

Description: For each of the comma seperated listed this is the number in the list that needs to be met.  Default will be all.
Name: ListCount

Description: Population type criterea to check for.
Name: PopulationType

Description: Defaults to all routes are valid
Name: RouteType

Description: How many instances of this route is required
Name: Amount

Description: Defaults to any tile in a city is valid to check, if Worked is true then only worked tiles
Name: Worked

Description: The number of slots to check for.
Name: Amount

Description: BY_COMBAT, BY_GIFT, BY_LIBERATION, BY_CULTURAL_IDENTITY, BY_FOUND, BY_INCORPORATE_CITY_STATE
Name: TransferType

Description: Specific age type
Name: AgeType

Description: Turn where the requirement is met.  After this turn passes requirement will never be met
Name: Turn

Description: Scales the turns with game speed
Name: Scale

Description: Turn where the requirement is met.  After this turn passes requirement will never be met
Name: Turn

Description: Turn where the requirement is met and will always be met.
Name: MinimumTurn

Description: Sets a turn requirement X after the requirement starts
Name: AfterTurn

Description: Scales the turns with game speed
Name: Scale

Description: The age count to check for
Name: AgeCount

Description: The legacy path to check
Name: LegacyPathType

Description: The Challenge IDs that have to be completed.
Name: Challenges

Description: The number of challenges that have to be completed, can be any subset from the challenge list.
Name: Threshold

Description: Select this if all challenges listed have to be completed (instead of defining a Threshold).
Name: CompleteAll

Description: The specific constructible to check for
Name: ConstructibleType

Description: The constructible tag to check for
Name: Tag

Description: Amount of techs player is behind. Cannot be less than 1
Name: Amount

Description: If true, only counts settlements not owned by the owner of the subject.
Name: onlyForeign

Description: If true, does not count Towns.
Name: noTowns

Description: If true, only counts settlements in Distant Lands.
Name: onlyDistantLands

Description: Comma seperated list of civilizations that player must be one of.
Name: CivilizationType

Description: If true, will look at the players past civilizations to determine if they were one of the listed
Name: IsPastCivilization

Description: The diplomacy action group. If not set will be all action types.
Name: ActionType

Description: Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met
Name: Repeatable

Description: Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met
Name: Repeatable

Description: Conquered city must be different than majority religion
Name: DifferentThanMajority

Description: Conquered city must be different than founded religion
Name: DifferentThanFounded

Description: Conquered city must have a religion
Name: HasReligion

Description: The specified wonder. It does use the constructible database, but will throw out non-wonder constructibles
Name: Wonder

Description: Used to specify a civs associated wonder instead of a specific wonder.  This will override Wonder parameter if it was also filled in.
Name: IsAssociatedWonder

Description: The legacy path to check for completed milestones
Name: LegacyPathType

Description: If set, the requirement will ignore checking the player's cities.
Name: IgnoreCities

Description: If set, the requirement will ignore checking the player's units.
Name: IgnoreUnits

Description: If defined, the player must possess at least 1 'UnitType' or (if IgnoreCities is false) the player must possess at least one city.
Name: UnitType

Description: The amount of other major civs the player has to initiate diplomacy with to pass the check.
Name: Amount

Description: Whether it's required for the player to initiate diplomacy with all other major civs (discards the Amount value if true).
Name: WithAll

Description: Specific Handicap
Name: Handicap

Description: The story to check
Name: StoryType

Description: How many tokens are invested into the independent
Name: Amount

Description: The least number of buildings to match the requirement
Name: Amount

Description: Match with wonder
Name: AssociatedWonder

Description: The tags to be matched in an OR statement fashion
Name: BuildingTag

Description: The type on the buildings
Name: BuildingType

Description: Only buildings from this age
Name: CurrentAge

Description: Only in distant lands
Name: DistantLands

Description: The least number of buildings to match the requirement
Name: Amount

Description: How many of the listed gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met.  Functions as an and/or manipulation
Name: Amount

Description: A turn window in which the gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met. The earliest gossip occurrence and the last must be within that turn window.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.
Name: TurnWindow

Description: Some gossips have a tile location where it occurred.  This sets a max distance of where two gossips must have occurred in order to be met.  If there are more than two gossips in the requirement, this will not check and will always be not met.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.
Name: Distance

Description: Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the turn set will not be considered. If used with AfterInit, the higher of the two will be used instead
Name: AfterTurn

Description: Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the story was initialized will not be considered.  If used with AfterTurn, the higher of the two will be used instead
Name: AfterInit

Description: Comma separated list of gossips to check against.  Each of these gossips becomes a new argument that can be used to provide additional parameters for the gossip.  This does expect two additional characters at the end to allow for duplicate gossip types with different parameters. eg If you want to check two GOSSIP_PILLAGE, enter GOSSIP_PILLAGE01 and GOSSIP_PILLAGE02.  The two additional characters must always be entered, regardless of duplicates or amount.
Name: GossipTypes

Description: Dynamic Entry is not actually the argument type.  Each of the entries in GossipTypes can be used as their own argument.  The value is a comma separated list for parameters to check against, but each parameter comes in sets of 3: value specifier, parameter key, parameter value. Value specifier is Hash or Numeric, indicating how to treat the third of the triplet.  Parameter key is one of the parameters of the gossip, and value is the value to check against. Example - Hash,ConstructibleType,BUILDING_LIBRARY,Numeric,AdjacencyBonus,3
Name: DynamicEntry

Description: When using 1 gossip requirement, how many of the same gossip must be met. Error to use multiple entries.
Name: DuplicateCount

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Name: UnitTag

Description: Max distance settlement center must be to untouched wonder for validity
Name: WonderDistance

Description: Victory points needed to meet requirement (a.k.a achieve this victory)
Name: PointsForVictory

Description: Victory points per new settlement created near untouched wonder
Name: PointsPerSettlementCenterNearWonder

Description: Victory points achieved per turn for meeting requirement
Name: PointsPerTurnUntouchedWonder

Description: True for if you own the settlement, false if city is revolting in your favour
Name: IsOwner

Description: The required number of maxed disciplines per commander.
Name: MaxedDisciplineCount

Description: How many commanders need the number of maxed disciplines.
Name: CommanderCount

Description: The required number of levels
Name: LevelCount

Description: How many commanders need the number of promotions.
Name: CommanderCount

Description: Whether level counts only commendations
Name: OnlyCommendations

Description: What type of commanders to look at
Name: DomainType

Description: The type of the tree to see if it was completed.
Name: CompletedProgressionTreeType

Description: The amount of trees to see if they were completed.
Name: TreesCompleted

Description: The amount of trees to see that are currently in progress.
Name: TreesInProgress

Description: A specific story to complete.
Name: StoryType

Description: How many actions have been completed. If both Amount and PlayerAmount are set it is an error.
Name: Amount

Description: How many players completed 1 action with. If both Amount and PlayerAmount are set it is an error.
Name: PlayerAmount

Description: The diplomacy action group. If not set will be all action types.
Name: ActionType

Description: How many nodes must we have unlocked?
Name: Amount

Description: Do we only care about Civics nodes?
Name: CultureOnly

Description: Do we only care about Tech nodes?
Name: TechOnly

Description: Do we only count Mastered nodes?
Name: MasteredOnly

Description: Is our question really 'have we finished the tree'?
Name: AllNodes

Description: The constructible to check against if filled.
Name: ConstructibleType

Description: How many great works it should be filled with, if unused will default to max for the constructible
Name: Amount

Description: If true, it only counts the players settlements
Name: SelfOnly

Description: If true, it only counts the players settlements
Name: OtherOnly

Description: If true, it only counts settlements on distant lands
Name: DistantLands

Description: The amount of plots revealed on which the requirement is met
Name: Threshold

Description: Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met
Name: Repeatable

Description: The amount of settlements founded on which the requirement is met
Name: Amount

Description: Whether the requirement only counts settled towns (via Settlers) towards the amount
Name: OnlyTowns

Description: Whether the requirement only counts settled cities (via Founders) towards the amount
Name: OnlyCities

Description: The type of the yield that player has to gain in order to meet this requirement.
Name: YieldType

Description: The name of an event that we need to send the dynamic progress data to.
Name: DynamicProgressEventName

Description: The government type to check for.
Name: GovernmentType

Description: The great work to check for.
Name: GreatWorkType

Description: The type of ideology we are checking for.
Name: IdeologyType

Description: If this is true, this requirement will be met if the player has any ideology. Overrides the IdeologyType argument.
Name: HasAnyIdeology

Description: The type of improvement that gets fertilized by random event
Name: ImprovementType

Description: The type of improvement that gets fertilized by random event
Name: EventOperator

Description: The amount of unique trade partners required to trade with player
Name: Amount

Description: If true, checks active tradition only at start of golden age. Defaults to false
Name: ActiveAtGoldenAge

Description: Set Value to the enum for the improvement or set to NO_IMPROVEMENT if want to check presence of ANY unique improvement
Name: ImprovementType

Description: Set Value to the enum for the quarter or set to NO_QUARTER if want to check presence of ANY unique quarter
Name: UniqueQuarterType

Description: How many other players must you have alliances with?
Name: Amount

Description: Are we unmet when you have more than this many alliances?
Name: IsExactAmount

Description: Will we trigger more than once?
Name: IsRepeatable

Description: Must you have an alliance with all Majors?
Name: AllMajors

Description: If AllMajors, is it okay if some have died?
Name: OnlyLiving

Description: Only count Players in the Foreign Hemisphere?
Name: ForeignHemisphere

Description: Only count Players in the Home Hemisphere?
Name: HomeHemisphere

Description: The number of settlements to check for.
Name: Amount

Description: The amount of masteries (technological and cultural) reached on which the requirement is met
Name: Amount

Description: Whether the requirement only counts cultural masteries reached towards the amount
Name: OnlyCivics

Description: Whether the requirement only counts technological masteries reached towards the amount
Name: OnlyTechs

Description: The number of resources slotted
Name: Amount

Description: The resource class type, such as RESOURCECLASS_FACTORY
Name: ResourceClassType

Description: How many other players must you have this relationship with?
Name: Amount

Description: Must you have this relationship with all Majors?
Name: AllMajors

Description: If AllMajors, is it okay if some have died?
Name: OnlyLiving

Description: Only count Players in the Foreign Hemisphere?
Name: ForeignHemisphere

Description: Only count Players in the Home Hemisphere?
Name: HomeHemisphere

Description: Only counts settlements you founded.
Name: OnlyFounded

Description: The required number of different religions.
Name: Amount

Description: The religions must be the majority in a city.
Name: MajorityOnly

Description: Which resources to check the player has.  Can be a comma separated list.
Name: ResourceType

Description: Which resources to check the player has.
Name: ResourceClass

Description: The required number of settlements that must follow a religion. Defaults to all settlements.
Name: Amount

Description: If true, the cities must follow a religion you founded. Defaults to true
Name: OnlyFounded

Description: The number of settlements needed.
Name: Count

Description: If true, only counts settlements in distant lands.
Name: OnlyDistantLands

Description: A list of biome types, if multiple biome types are given the count will include settlements in both types.
Name: BiomeType

Description: The required number of trade routes established with another player
Name: Amount

Description: The required number of trade routes established
Name: Amount

Description: Whether to sum up all players for amount.
Name: AllPlayers

Description: Whether the route must be to foreign lands.
Name: DistantLands

Description: Is this boost to land routes or sea routes
Name: DomainType

Description: How many other players must you have alliances with?
Name: Amount

Description: A specific type of war?
Name: WarType

Description: A war with a specific (other) Civilization?
Name: CivilizationType

Description: Exclude wars declared by the opponent?
Name: DeclaredByOwner

Description: Exclude wars declared by the owner?
Name: DeclaredByOpponent

Description: Must you have a war with all Majors?
Name: AllMajors

Description: If AllMajors, is it okay if some have died?
Name: OnlyLiving

Description: Only count Players in the Foreign Hemisphere?
Name: ForeignHemisphere

Description: Only count Players in the Home Hemisphere?
Name: HomeHemisphere

Description: Victory points needed to fulfill this requirement
Name: PointsForVictory

Description: Victory points achieved for every improvement built on a natural wonder tile
Name: PointsForImprovementConstructed

Description: Victory points achieved per turn for built natural wonder improvements
Name: PointsForImprovementsPerTurn

Description: The required diplomatic response type
Name: RespnseType

Description: To specify a specific opposing ideology.
Name: IdeologyType

Description: Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met
Name: Repeatable

Description: A list of progression tree node types to check for. Assumes that all of the provided nodes are from the same progression tree.
Name: ProgressionTreeNodeType

Description: A specific node depth to check for. All provided nodes are checked for the same depth level.
Name: SpecificDepth

Description: Single gossip to check against.
Name: GossipTypes

Description: Dynamic Entry is not actually the argument type.  The entry in GossipTypes is used as its own argument.  The value is a comma separated list for parameters to check against, but each parameter comes in sets of 3: value specifier, parameter key, parameter value. Value specifier is Hash or Numeric, indicating how to treat the third of the triplet.  Parameter key is one of the parameters of the gossip, and value is the value to check against. Example - Hash,ConstructibleType,BUILDING_LIBRARY,Numeric,AdjacencyBonus,3
Name: DynamicEntry

Description: The constructible being replaced
Name: OldConstructibleType

Description: The constructible replacing the old one
Name: NewConstructibleType

Description: The biome of the location
Name: BiomeType

Description: The player is the origianl owner of the settlement
Name: IsOriginalOwner

Description: Overbuilding doesn't track improvements, but this will allow it.  Not compatible with NewCosntructibleType.
Name: AnyOverbuild

Description: The amount of plots revealed on which the requirement is met
Name: PlotsRevealed

Description: The number of times a player must have reconquered a settlement they lost in the same age.
Name: Count

Description: Whether to trigger on building any wonder.
Name: AnyWonder

Description: The required number of resources gained from a trade route
Name: Amount

Description: The building both endpoints must have.
Name: BuildingType

Description: Which resource to check for trading.  Can be a comma separated list.
Name: ResourceType

Description: The number of trade routes to have with each of the players.
Name: Amount

Description: The amount of unique trade partners required.  If amount and percent not specified it is every major player
Name: Amount

Description: The percent of alive players to trade with. If amount and percent not specified it is every major player
Name: Percent

Description: Which resource to check for trading.  Can be a comma separated list.
Name: ResourceType

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Name: UnitTag

Description: Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Name: UnitTag

Description: The count of first placed victories to achieve
Name: VictoryCount

Description: The victory type to check
Name: Victory

Description: The victory class type to check
Name: VictoryClass

Description: The minimum place required to be met, or if specific, the exact place that needs to be met
Name: Place

Description: Wether the place needs to be exact, or at a minimum
Name: Specific

Description: The victory type to check
Name: Victory

Description: The minimum progress required to be met, as an int
Name: MinimumProgress

Description: Whether to check progress as a percentage or not, e.g. 50 for 50%. Default is true
Name: Percentage

Description: The unit type to match against.  Includes replacement types but not base types.
Name: UnitType

Description: Whether or not to include the center hex.
Name: IncludeCenter

Description: If true, only looks for cities owned by the owner of the plot being checked.  If false, only looks for cities not owned by the owner of the plot being checked.
Name: isOwner

Description: The amount of resources that must be slotted in the adjacent cities to qualify.
Name: Amount

Description: If true, only looks for constructibles owned by the owner of the plot being checked.  If false, only looks for constructibles not owned by the owner of the plot being checked.
Name: isOwner

Description: The amount of great works that must be slotted in the adjacent constructible to qualify.
Name: Amount

Description: The constructible class that counts, e.g. buildings
Name: constructibleClass

Description: If true, only looks for wonders owned by the plot owner.  If false, only looks for wonders not owned by the plot owner.
Name: isOwner

Description: The biome expected.
Name: Biome

Description: Amount to meet or exceed to for the requirement to return true. This is ignored if UseAppealHappinessThreshold is set to true.
Name: Amount

Description: Uses the APPEAL_FOR_HAPPINESS_TILE_YIELD() value set in Global Parameters as the Amount.
Name: UseAppealHappinessThreshold

Description: The specific constructible to check for
Name: ConstructibleType

Description: The constructible tag to check for
Name: Tag

Description: The age of the building to check for
Name: Age

Description: Can be used with the preceding arguments to check how many applicable constructibles are in the plot. Greater than the count returns true
Name: Count

Description: Checks if the plot is adjacent to a navigable river. Can only be used with ConstructibleType
Name: NavigableRiver

Description: The route expected.
Name: RouteType

Description: Reinforcement calls count during a single war.
Name: SingleWarCount

Description: Comma separated unit tags that a unit has to pack
Name: Tags

Description: Comma separated unit core classes that a unit has to pack
Name: CoreClasses

Description: The minimum number of packed units to check for
Name: Amount

Description: Whether or not to count combat units
Name: CountCombatUnits

Description: Whether or not to count noncombat units
Name: CountNonCombatUnits

Description: The threshold amount to check
Name: Amount

Description: Check for below the threshold
Name: BelowAmount

Description: Whether to only check the owner's units or all units.
Name: friendlyOnly

Description: If the unit is garrisoned, the district has active fortifcations, such as walls
Name: RequiresGarrisoned

Description: The required district type. All types are included if this is empty
Name: DistrictType

Description: Is it required that the player owns the district?
Name: Owned

Description: A list of the district types to check for. Requirement will be met if unit is occupying any of those types
Name: DistrictType

Description: Wether or not to only check for districts in friendly territory
Name: Friendly

Description: A comma separated list of tags to match with the unit.
Name: Tag

Description: Set true if the unit must match all supplied tags. Default behavior is that only one provided tag needs to match.
Name: MatchAllTags
